data.title: US swimmer Ryan Lochte to have his 'passport seized by Brazilian authorities' over false claims he was robbed
France’s Prime Minister has backed the banning of burkini swimsuits, saying they are not compatible with French values and are based on the “enslavement of women”.
The Netherlands is considering a ban on selling gas-powered cars in the next 10 years
'Disciple of Jesus Christ' is not an occupation, Irish High Court rules: 'The courts are not a playground in which litigants can amuse themselves at will,' says Mr Justice Richard Humphreys
Three more towns in France to join burkini ban
Kim Jong-Un 'promoting dog meat as a superfood' - North Korea is promoting the consumption of dog meat by suggesting it has more vitamins than chicken, beef, pork or duck.
Irish fighter gives judges the middle finger as corruption allegation engulfs boxing
Rio 2016: IOC President condemns ‘shocking behaviour’ after crowd booed French pole vaulter Renaud Lavillenie until he cried

Poland approves bill outlawing phrase 'Polish death camps' - Cabinet approves legislation that could see someone imprisoned for three years for using phrase to refer to second world war concentration camps
Turkey to release 38,000 prisoners 'to make room for arrested coup plotters'
